description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to improve access to care and quality of care for TB patients including the most vulnerable including children, refugees, and prisoners

participating-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

activity-description.narrative: Support National TB&HIV Programmes to increase treatment

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

Résultats Extension Janvier-Juin 2018 Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses : 529 Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the bacteriologically confirmed TB cases registered during a specified period :79.45% Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment :73.84% Number of cases with drug resistant TB (RR-TB and/or MDR-TB) that began second-line treatment : 23 Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy among all adults and children living with HIV : 31.03% Pourcentage dadultes et denfants qui ont commencé la thérapie antirétrovirale, avec une charge virale indétectable à 12 mois (<1000 copies/ml) : 46.66% Percentage of HIV-positive pregnant women who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission:87.50%
